title: Tension - string between block and cart

content.question: A block and cart, connected by an ideal string, are moving along a horizontal surface as shown. The mass of the block is greater than the mass of the cart. At three equally spaced points, <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, along the string, the tensions are <math alttext="T sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="T sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, respectively. Which of the following correctly ranks the magnitudes of the tensions at these points?

choices.label: <math alttext="T sub 1 equals T sub 2, which equals T sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="T sub 1 is greater than T sub 2, which is greater than T sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="T sub 1 equals T sub 3, which is greater than T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="T sub 3 is greater than T sub 2, which is greater than T sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="T sub 1 equals T sub 2, which equals T sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
